website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills corded electric drill that offers good power at a competitive price. Its lack of speed control is a concern, however.
pros: This corded drill features a 3 A motor boasting 2,700 rpm
A keyless chuck makes switching bits easy
The 6-foot cord makes life a bit easier when working
cons: Doesn't have variable speed, meaning it goes from 0 to 100 in an instant, affecting control
A few users reported nonworking or defective drills on arrival

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just to knock out a few household tasks (building ikea furniture, installing a TV wall mount, hanging pictures, etc.) so I didn't want to break the bank to do so. The drill gets the job done, especially for the price, but I wish it had some sort of speed control. It has one speed, and that speed is very fast. That was fine for drilling into my walls, but ended up making some tasks like a building an ikea bed a bit harder than good old fashioned man power.
customer_reviews.author: William Williamson

customer_reviews.title: This is a good drill with lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This is a good drill with lots of power, only real thing I don't like with it and the reason for 4 stars is you do not have the ability to control speed or power either by a torque clutch behind the bit clutch which I knew before purchasing but also not in the switch. Once you apply even the slightest bit of switch pressure, you are at 100% power. Not bad if your drilling. Not perfect if your screwing.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: I got to that point so I got this and I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Eventually you get tired of looking for your screw gun only to find out the battery is dead. Then you find out the battery for it won't take a charge anymore. I got to that point so I got this and I'm glad I did! Yes it's powerful so be forewarned. You need to find the "sweet spot" with it, but I'm SOOOOO happy I don't have to look for a dead battery anymore!
customer_reviews.author: MLW825

customer_reviews.title: Useful household drill
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to change bits on the drill. I like having the power cord for household uses so it always has constant power and I don't have to worry about charging and replacing batteries.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Sublett

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for several projects, and the price was amazing so I figured why not. I've definitely put it through hell and back. The Chuck broke fairly fast, but I just stick a nail or stick or whatever is laying around into the cooling fan to keep it locked while tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Drill!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first drill and I purchased it to drill some holes in some of my gardening pots. This thing has some serious power!!! I drilled the holes in my pots in minutes flat and was walking around the house trying to see what else I needed to do! Haha. I'd definitely recommend for a beginner like myself!
customer_reviews.author: GAGardenGal

customer_reviews.title: I love this drill
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill, it is really worth the price and has made building things so much easier for me, however you do need to purchase extra drill bits if you want to make holes along with what holds them into the head piece which was an extra $18 to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva M.

customer_reviews.title: No-frills functionality
customer_reviews.text: This item works- you squeeze the trigger and the bit spins. It does not have any variable speeds. Perhaps I'm spoiled, but I didn't realize these existed without that feature. It is essentially a no-frills functional item, but at the same time, gives me no reason to absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jericho

customer_reviews.title: Too much power for little jobs
customer_reviews.text: Overpowered, jeez..cant drive a screw into anything, speed goes from nothing to full blast with no in between. PS...review is from me, a total non pro at stuff like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if i would have known that this drill doesnt have ...
customer_reviews.text: if i would have known that this drill doesnt have a 'slower' speed i would not have purchased. it jumps from 0 to 100
customer_reviews.author: andrew jones

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It only has one speed so makes it harder to screw things together because you can't start out slow wish I didn't buy it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was great though on providing a refund
customer_reviews.text: Started smoking first time I used it. Amazon was great though on providing a refund. Maybe I just got a defective one, it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B.

customer_reviews.title: Always keep a corded drill in your shop.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can not beat this item. It is always handy to have a corded drill around the shop. This one is incredibly cheap and packs a punch. It shipped fast and cam in its original packing,
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lalor

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cheap drill and didn't need a battery operated drill. This grill feels heavy duty and works well. Great drill for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John J Campo

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This drill has two speeds, fast and stop. Not good for inticate tasks. Work for easy, basic jobs. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa19643

customer_reviews.title: as it's useless for most applications as it is now
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, as others have mentioned, it only has 1 speed and that is fast. So you have to intermittently hit the trigger to get a slower speed. It really should have a dial/switch to regulate the speed, as it's useless for most applications as it is now.
customer_reviews.author: Beelzebub

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Got rid of my old drill in error... This was a GREAT replacement for quick jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Puffy R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he absolutely loves it. I loved the price. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: BooksRMyLife

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is only a single speed drill not a variable speed drill.
customer_reviews.author: Nasir K.

customer_reviews.title: No drill bit included, despite being listed in the ...
customer_reviews.text: No drill bit included, despite being listed in the Product Details on the site and on the Black & Decker box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price, I could not pass it up.
customer_reviews.author: HYPER

customer_reviews.title: No speed settings.
customer_reviews.text: No speed setting. Spins super fast and no way to spin slow so not good for small screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as it claims, had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Caliz

customer_reviews.title: Great price and works well
customer_reviews.text: Great price and works well. I love the keyless chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Gretel

customer_reviews.title: Good Drill
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to, it is corded so you have a wire tieing you down, other than that, there is not one complaint.
customer_reviews.author: atempleton

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Drills way to fast, can not even grip screws. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Kielpinksi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome drill, Does the job on everything I needed it for in the house, and i don't have to worry about charging a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ang81Zip

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the chuck was frozen in place could not move at all, had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: richard weyel

customer_reviews.title: a dud
customer_reviews.text: not the power i thought it would have won't recommed to anyone. cheaply made. not good for every day use
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product ,good price ,fast delivery .just what i wanted
customer_reviews.author: donna smith

customer_reviews.title: The drill is great. The only drawback is the keyless chuck
customer_reviews.text: The drill was great until it died on me in the middle of a project. The stupid thing is only 2 months old. Black & Dicker should be ashamed of themselves for putting their name on this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edgar Soliz

customer_reviews.title: this dill is amazing, i got what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: this drill is amazing, i got what i was looking for, i was able to make holes on galvanized iron. 5 stars for you baby. yeah.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 Hour
customer_reviews.text: Worked for literally one hour and now does NOTHING and my project came to a standstill. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: laurie

customer_reviews.title: Very good entry level Drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill to use with the 3M rust & paint remover wheels. it does that very well. The single speed, reversible drill is an entry level power tool. PRO's: 6 foot long cord high speed - 2700 RPM speed locking button reversable CON's: Thermal protection - I bought 2 drills, and one kept shutting off due to a defective internal thermal protection switch. Reversing switch is sort of chintzy feeling. Not for any driving as it is single speed [I'm not using it for that anyway] Overall a decent quality drill, made in China w/ a 2 year consumer warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Datil Mountain Muse

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER BDEDR3C 120V 3/8" Corded Drill
product_meta.description: The BLACK+DECKER BDEDR3C 120-volt 3/8-inch Corded Drill is perfect is ideal for drilling holes in wood, metal and plastic. It can also be used for driving screws to fasten a variety of materials. This drill features a keyless chuck for convenience, a comfort grip handle for better grip and to help eliminate user fatigue, a 3-amp motor, 2,700 RPM, and includes a double-ended screw driving bit. This is commonly used for drilling and driving. The BDEDR3C is backed by a BLACK+DECKER 1 Year Limited Warranty for added peace of mind.
feature_bullets: Double ended screw driving bit included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars76 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
